definition: to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: To some men marriage is a bit like being in a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 對有的男人來說，結婚就有點像上館子。

sentences.english: They usually eat out on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 星期天他們通常上館子喫飯。

sentences.english: We ate out to celebrate Mom's birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我們上館子喫飯來慶祝媽媽的生日。

sentences.english: I'm too tired to cook. Shall we eat out tonight?
sentences.chinese: 我太累了不想做飯了。我們上館子怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Japanese businessman invited a Jewish painter to eat out.
sentences.chinese: 有一個日本商人請一位猶太畫家上館子喫飯。

sentences.english: Restaurants are great, but can they beat a homecooked meal?
sentences.chinese: 餐館好雖好，但上館子會比喫自家烹調的餐點更好嗎？

sentences.english: Would you mind eating out this evening?
sentences.chinese: 你介意今晚上館子喫飯嗎？

sentences.english: Do you eat out a lot in London?
sentences.chinese: 你們在倫敦經常上館子喫飯嗎？

definition: Yancheng district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
soft mixed vegetable and meat roll-up
food given to Buddhist monks as alms
fried chicken pieces with salt and pepper/Taiwan-style fried chicken
